page.title: 08Bardon Hill Quarry (cont)
page.content: Mr.Gregory Tom of Bardon Hill House is the{Managing Director}of the Quarry His father bought the Quarry in 1947 from Ellis and Everard and Mr.Tom took over from his father. Mr.Tom's two sons are also directors of the Quarry. Mr.Tom also owns much of the{farmland around the Quarry, so he owns about 1000 acres altogether. The farmland is rented out to farmers. Bardon Hill has lots of{customers} both abroad and in this country.They are mostly in the South of England because there are no hard stone quarries south of Bardon Hill. In 1964 Bardon Hill Quarry developed a{special {dust}for runways.This helps to prevent aeroplanes skidding in wet weather. Also a specialist dust is made for putting in floor emulsion and is sent to France and Germany.
